A4.text: In Wales and Northern Ireland, English is coâ€‘official alongside Welsh and Irish respectively.

A5.text: In the United Kingdom, the United States, Australia, and New Zealand, it is the dominant language for historical reasons without being explicitly defined by law.

A6.text: English is the most widely spoken and de facto official language of the United Kingdom.

A7.text: Welsh is spoken by 538,300 people in Wales according to the 2021 census

A8.text: In 2001, over 92,000 people in Scotland, just under 2 per cent of the population, had some Gaelic language ability, including 72 per cent of those living in the Outer Hebrides.

A9.text: In 2019 some three-quarters of a million people spoke little or no English.
